required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Clinical Trial Assessing The Impact Of Inhaled Insulin On Glucose Control In Patients With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus
clinical_study.official_title: A Six Month, Open-label Outpatient, Parallel Group Trial Assessing The Impact Of Inhaled Insulin (Exubera(Registered)) On Glycemic Control In Patients With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus Who Are Poorly Controlled On Two Oral Anti-diabetic Agents

brief_summary.textblock: To assess the impact on glucose control by inhaled insulin in patients with type 2 diabetes who are not well controlled on 2 or more oral anti-diabetic agents

clinical_study.why_stopped: Terminated as marketing of this product will be discontinued

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage Change From Baseline in Glycosylated Hemoglobin (HbA1c) at Week 24

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving Glycemic Control by Visit
secondary_outcome.description: 2 definitions of good glycemic control were used: an HbA1c result of ≤6.5% or ≤7.0%

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in FEV1 at Week 24 LOCF

arm_group.description: Standard of Care: All licensed diabetes drugs can be prescribed per discretion of investigators

intervention.description: Addition of inhaled insulin to pre-existing oral diabetes therapy.
Standard of Care: All licensed diabetes drugs can be prescribed per discretion of investigators

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diabetes mellitus type 2
- Failing two or more oral anti-diabetic agents
Exclusion Criteria:
- Asthma, COPD
- Smoking

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Total subjects enrolled=354. Total subjects given study drug=351. (ie, 3 subjects withdrew after enrollment/randomization, but prior to receiving study drug)

group.title: Standard of Care
group.description: Standard of Care: All licensed diabetes drugs can be prescribed per discretion of investigators

group.title: Standard of Care
group.description: Standard of Care: All licensed diabetes drugs can be prescribed per discretion of investigators

outcome.title: Percentage Change From Baseline in Glycosylated Hemoglobin (HbA1c) at Week 24
outcome.population: Out of 180 and 171 subjects that were treated with study drug and usual care, respectively, the Full Analysis Set (FAS)for each group which was analyzed for efficacy, was 179 and 170 subjects, respectively.

group.title: Standard of Care
group.description: Standard of Care: All licensed diabetes drugs can be prescribed per discretion of investigators

measure.title: Percentage Change From Baseline in Glycosylated Hemoglobin (HbA1c) at Week 24
measure.population: Out of 180 and 171 subjects that were treated with study drug and usual care, respectively, the Full Analysis Set (FAS)for each group which was analyzed for efficacy, was 179 and 170 subjects, respectively.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Achieving Glycemic Control by Visit
outcome.description: 2 definitions of good glycemic control were used: an HbA1c result of ≤6.5% or ≤7.0%
outcome.population: Out of 180 and 171 subjects that were treated with study drug and usual care, respectively, the Full Analysis Set (FAS)for each group which was analyzed for efficacy, was 179 and 170 subjects, respectively. LOCF=last observation carried forward.

group.title: Standard of Care
group.description: Standard of Care: All licensed diabetes drugs can be prescribed per discretion of investigators

measure.title: Percentage of Participants Achieving Glycemic Control by Visit
measure.description: 2 definitions of good glycemic control were used: an HbA1c result of ≤6.5% or ≤7.0%
measure.population: Out of 180 and 171 subjects that were treated with study drug and usual care, respectively, the Full Analysis Set (FAS)for each group which was analyzed for efficacy, was 179 and 170 subjects, respectively. LOCF=last observation carried forward.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in FEV1 at Week 24 LOCF
outcome.population: Out of 180 and 171 subjects that were treated with study drug and usual care, respectively, the Full Analysis Set (FAS)for each group which was analyzed for efficacy, was 179 and 170 subjects, respectively.FEV1=forced expiratory volume in 1 second;LOCF=last observation carried forward.

measure.population: Out of 180 and 171 subjects that were treated with study drug and usual care, respectively, the Full Analysis Set (FAS)for each group which was analyzed for efficacy, was 179 and 170 subjects, respectively.FEV1=forced expiratory volume in 1 second;LOCF=last observation carried forward.

group.title: Standard of Care
group.description: Standard of Care: All licensed diabetes drugs can be prescribed per discretion of investigators

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of <60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), <12 mo from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential info other than study results.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Study terminated prematurely since the sponsor stopped marketing and manufacturing of EXUBERA and withdrew Market Authorization in Europe in September 2008. No efficacy, safety, or quality reason was associated with the premature halt of this study.
